string.name: paragraph
string.ol:
an original valid primary identity document(passport)\n
an original valid secondary document (only applicable if you have reached the age of majority in your province or territory of residence)\n
an original valid supporting document (only applicable if the name on any document provided is different from the name on the SIN application)

string.name: para2
string.ol:
a digital copy of an original valid primary identity document (you must provide both sides of the document if there is identity information on each side)\n
a digital copy of an original valid secondary document \n
a digital copy of a proof of address\n
a digital copy of an original valid supporting document (only applicable if the name on any document provided is different from the name on the online SIN application)

string.name: para3
string.ol:
an original valid primary identity document

a completed and signed SIN application form. If you are unable to print the application form, you can order one by phone at:
 1-866-274-6627 (toll free number) or,/n if outside Canada, at 1-506-548-7961 (long distance charges will apply)

an original valid supporting document (only applicable if the name on your primary identity document is different from the name on the SIN application)

string.name: para4
string.b: 400 City Hall Square East, Suite 103\n Windsor, Ontario

resources.string:
Head to a Superstore (Canadian supermarket chain) or affiliate.You’ll likely need to activate the SIM card yourself, which takes about 5-10 min over the phone. Activating online only works with phones they sell to you.


Required documents:

Passport

Study permit 


you will require an unlocked phone or have to buy a phone from the provider. If your phone is currently locked, you may also be able to get it unlocked in a general mobile store if you don’t mind losing your warranty.

Canada has three main providers (Bell, Telus, Rogers), and a host of smaller resellers, including a few owned by the “big three” themselves.


There are also a couple of outliers such as Freedom Mobile that have worse coverage and use less common GSM frequencies. While the company’s 4G/LTE rollout makes it compatible with a wider range of international phones than in the past, most travelers will still be better off looking elsewhere.

 PC Mobile is the best bet if you would like a little bit of talk and text with your data. The SIM card costs $10 CAD, which includes a $10 credit on your account.

 Basic call and text packages start at $10 CAD/month. If you’d like a useful amount of data as well (and most people do,) package prices start at $25/month for 2GB, rising to $50/month for 8GB. You can add additional data for $10/GB, but weirdly, only on the top-tier package.
How to Buy a SIM Card in Canada
